abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Education Sector
            Project for Ghana are to: (a) improve equitable access to
            and completion of basic education in deprived districts; and
            (b) improve quality of teaching and learning, management
            efficiency and relevance of post-basic education. The
            project components are: (i) sector capacity building and
            management; (ii) pilot programmatic scheme (PPS); and (iii)
            teaching and learning innovation fund (TALIF) to provide
            development and innovation to the tertiary education sector.
            The reallocation is necessary to cover the outstanding
            remaining payments for annual programs of work under the
            category three annual programs-GES (pilot programmatic
            scheme) and for the category two-A consulting services MOE
            (sector capacity building).
